intro: Hartia yunnanensis var. gracilis, commonly known as the Yunnan hartia, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, finely divided leaves, and small white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
